dummy: I am in ENGLISH translation file only

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.help: The proposal abstract should clearly communicate the proposal’s objectives, relevance, expected outcomes, and potential impact, serving as a high-level overview of the proposal's essential points. The abstract should be succinct yet detailed enough to convey the essence of the proposal, highlighting its innovation and relevance to the field. The text should be a maximum of 250 words.
abstract.helper: Please enter the abstract of your proposal. This field allows latex syntax. - Word count {{current}} / {{max}}

addPanel.label: Add Panel
addPanel.toolTip: Click to add a new panel.
addPanel.warning: Please wait whilst we create a new panel.

addProposal.toolTip: Click to add a new proposal.
addProposal.warning: Please wait whilst we create a new proposal.

addTarget.error: Failed to add target - check for duplicate

panelName.toolTip: Name of Panel to be created.

arrayConfiguration.label: Array Configuration
arrayConfiguration.help: Specify an array configuration. Currently the SKA has two arrays - SKA-MID (350MHz - 154GHz) and SKA-LOW (50MHz – 350 MHz).

assignBtn.label: Assign
assignBtn.toolTip: Assign proposals to a review panel

assignProposals.label: Assign Proposals
assignProposals.toolTip: Click to assign proposals to the panel.
assignProposals.warning: Please wait whilst we assign the proposals.

help.0: Zoom Bandwidth of the observation. LOW supports eight channelization schemes in zoom mode, each with a unique combination of frequency resolution and bandwidth. MID supports seven channelisation schemes in zoom mode, each with a unique combination of frequency resolution and bandwidth.
help.1: The continuum bandwidth of the observation. It must be fully contained within the selected band. Note: For LOW, the specified bandwidth must be equal to or larger than 5.43 kHz, which is the width of a LOW continuum channel. The specified bandwidth must be fully contained within the LOW band (50 - 350 MHz). It cannot exceed 75 MHz for the AA0.5 and AA1 configurations, 150 MHz for the AA2 configuration and 300 MHz for the AA* and AA4 configurations. For MID, note that for the AA0.5, AA1 and AA2 configurations, the specified bandwidth cannot exceed 800 MHz.

range.minimumChannelWidthError: Bandwidth must be larger than the channel width ({{value}} kHz)
range.contMaximumExceededError: Maximum bandwidth for this array assembly ({{value}} MHz) exceeded
range.rangeError: Bandwidth must be fully contained within the band

centralFrequency.help: The central frequency of the observation. Must be within the selected band.
centralFrequency.label: Central Frequency

changeProposal.label: Change Proposal's type?
changeProposal.content1: You are about to change the type of your proposal.
changeProposal.content2: Some data specific to the proposal type may be lost.

clearBtn.label: Clear
clearBtn.toolTip: This will clear the file upload selection

reason.conflict-none: I have no conflict of interest

reason.conflict-collaborator: I am a current / recent collaborator of the author(s)
reason.conflict-other: Other reasons prevent me from rendering a fair and impartial judgement

conflict.tooltip: Indicate whether there is a conflict of interest with this proposal

continuumUnits.help: Enter the continuum desired bandwidth, which should be in the same units as the observing band selected.

decisionComments.label: Decision Comments
decisionComments.help: Comments provided by the chairperson when making a decision on the proposal.

effectiveResolution.help: This field displays the channel width after applying the spectral averaging.
effectiveResolution.label: Effective Resolution

elevation.help: Specify the minimum elevation angle at which the target will be observed. This value must fall between the horizon and the target's zenith elevation. If the specified elevation is outside this range, an error message will be displayed. The default minimum elevation is 20 deg for LOW and 45 deg for MID.
elevation.label: Minimum Elevation

range.error: Value must be within the range of {{min}} to {{max}} degrees inclusive

email.label: Email
email.help: The email is a required field and must be provided. The investigator will be invited to participate in this proposal using this email so please ensure it is correct.

invitation.subject: Proposal invitation.
invitation.body: You have been invited to contribute to proposal {{id}}

email.error: Email invite was unsuccessful and member is not added

emailSearch.label: Email
emailSearch.help: This email should be of a registered user within SKAO systems. For example, @skao.int, @assoc.skao.int, or @community.skao.int.
emailSearch.error: User could not be found. Please check the email address and try again.

empty.cell: There are no contents for this cell

firstName.label: First Name
firstName.help: First name of the principal investigator or co-investigator.

getReviewers.label: Get Reviewers
getReviewers.toolTip: Click to get the list of reviewers.
getReviewers.warning: Please wait whilst we retrieve the reviewers.

groupObservations.label: Group
groupObservations.help: This field allows you to group observations. To create a group select the `New Group` from the dropdown and type a name of choice. 'None' is the default, in which case, the observation is not added to any group. After creating a group, observations can be added to same group using the dropdown and selecting the created group name or a new one can be created.
groupObservations.toolTip: Add a group if observations need to be grouped.

homeBtn.label: Home
homeBtn.title: Proposals
homeBtn.tooltip: Returns to the list of proposals

warningNotLoggedIn.title: Warning
warningNotLoggedIn.message: You are not logged in. The save function is currently disabled, and any unsaved progress will be lost if you return to the landing page. Are you sure you want to continue?

imageSize.label: Image Size
imageSize.help: Specify the image size based on the selected data product(s) in arcseconds, arcminutes or degrees.
imageSize.error: A value greater than zero is required

imageWeighting.help: Select natural, uniform or Briggs weighting. For Briggs weighting, the robustness parameter can be set to -2 (closest to uniform weighting), -1, 0, 1 or 2 (closest to natural weighting).
imageWeighting.label: Image Weighting

lastName.label: Last Name
lastName.help: Last name of the principal investigator or co-investigator.

listOfTargets.label: List of Targets
listOfTargets.toolTip: A list of targets can be created individually or imported from a csv file using the appropriate tab.

manageTeamMember.label: Manage Team Member Rights
manageTeamMember.success: Team member's access has been updated.
manageTeamMember.error: Failed to update team member's access.
manageTeamMember.help: Select the rights for this team member. The Principal Investigator (PI) has all rights by default. The PI can assign rights to other team members as needed.

submit.label: Submit rights
submit.help: Check to indicate that this individual can submit, edit and view the proposal.

edit.label: Edit rights
edit.help: Check to indicate that this individual can edit and view the proposal.

view.label: View rights
view.help: Check to indicate that this individual can view the proposal.

mediaSize.notSupported: The application is not supported on a screen with these dimensions

name.label: Name
name.help: Name of the target/object. If you want to automatically populate the coordinates then provide a name of a known object and use the resolve button to query SIMBAD first and NED if not found. However, you can provide an arbitrary target/object name which can contain any character and enter the coordinate values.

observingBand.help: Select the observing band to use for the observation. The available bands are 50 MHz - 350 MHz for LOW; and Band 1 (0.35-1.05 GHz), Band 2 (0.95-1.76 GHz), Band 5a (4.6-8.5 GHz) and Band 5b (8.3-15.4 GHz) for MID.
observingBand.label: Observing Band

observationId.label: Observation ID
observationId.help: A unique identifier of the observation. A default identifier is auto-generated but this can be overridden by typing into the field.
observationId.notUnique: Another observation with this unique identifier exists

dp.label: Observation
dp.help: Select the observation set for which you want to request a data product(s).

observationType.label: Observation Type
observationType.help: Specify if the observation type is continuum or zoom. Note that not all sub-arrays have zoom mode so this option is available based on the sub-array selected.

observatoryDataProduct.label: Observatory Data Product
observatoryDataProduct.help: Select the desired data product(s) by checking the boxes as appropriate.

observationDetails.help: Provide any further details about specific targets or any other considerations about observation(s).
observationDetails.label: Details

proposal.error: Unable to retrieve the proposal from the server

desc.1: These projects will be rapid responses to events that may be triggered either internal or external to the Observatory. ToO status may be recommended by the TAC or awarded by the Director-General. In some cases ToOs will have override status over other projects currently (or about to be) executing on the telescope.
desc.2: A JSP project requires both SKA-Low and SKA-Mid telescopes to achieve its science goals and may require observations to be executed contemporaneously.
desc.3: A project requiring SKA observations to be coordinated with another facility (either ground-based or space-based) with user-specified scheduling constraints provided. A common example of a CP will be a VLBI project, which will require the synchronized participation of a number of additional radio facilities.
desc.4: These projects require more than one proposal cycle to complete (e.g., long-term monitoring campaigns) but are too short in overall observing time, limited in observatory resources and/or scientific scope to qualify as a KSP.

proposalAttribute.help: One or more of these optional attributes may be selected to further refine the proposal
proposalAttribute.label: Attribute

proposals.empty: THERE ARE NO PROPOSALS TO BE DISPLAYED
proposals.label: proposals
proposals.name: Name
proposals.overviewTooltip: Tooltip for the card on the Overview

desc.1: Observing projects that require less time than a KSP, typically over a single time allocation cycle.
desc.2: Observing projects that require the allocation of significant observing time and resources often over a period longer than a single observing cycle. Specific criteria that define a KSP will be described in each call for proposals.
desc.3: Time allocated by the Director-General outside the normal process of assessment by the Time Allocation Committee (TMC).

proposalType.help: Select from the options below the most appropriate type classification for the proposal. This can be changed later if needed, however be aware that this may affect information previously entered.
proposalType.label: Proposal Type

members.label: Investigator(s)
members.empty: THERE ARE NO INVESTIGATORS ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROPOSAL

noSpecificTarget.toolTip: Current functionality is not yet available

feasibility.label: Feasibility
feasibility.info: A comment is required for this response

rank.hovering: Hovering - Click to select this rank
rank.label: Rank
rank.helper: Click on the center (0) or any segment (1-9) to set your ranking

0.title: Neutral
0.description: No preference or opinion. This represents a completely neutral stance with no positive or negative feelings.

1.title: Strongly Dislike
1.description: Very negative feelings. This represents the lowest level of preference with strong opposition or dislike.

2.title: Dislike
2.description: Negative feelings. This indicates a clear preference against this option, though not as strong as level 1.

3.title: Somewhat Dislike
3.description: Mild negative feelings. This represents a slight preference against this option with some reservations.

4.title: Slightly Dislike
4.description: Minor negative feelings. This indicates a very slight preference against this option.

5.title: Slightly Like
5.description: Minor positive feelings. This indicates a very slight preference for this option.

6.title: Somewhat Like
6.description: Mild positive feelings. This represents a slight preference for this option with some positive aspects.

7.title: Like
7.description: Positive feelings. This indicates a clear preference for this option with good positive feelings.

8.title: Strongly Like
8.description: Very positive feelings. This represents the highest level of preference with strong positive feelings.

9.title: Perfect
9.description: Absolute positive feelings. This represents the ultimate level of preference with perfect satisfaction.

referenceCoordinates.help: Only Galactic and ICRS reference systems are available.
referenceCoordinates.label: Reference System

referenceFrame.label: Reference Frame
referenceFrame.help: The reference frame of the velocity entered. The default is Heliocentric.

rightAscension.help: Right ascension can be in hours, minutes, and seconds, where 24 hours represents a full 360-degree rotation. For example, '+33:55:00.00'.
rightAscension.label: Right ascension

robust.help: For Briggs weighting, the robustness parameter can be set to -2 (closest to uniform weighting), -1, 0, 1 or 2 (closest to natural weighting).
robust.label: Robust

scienceCategory.label: Science Category
scienceCategory.help: Select a category that best describes the science of your proposal.

scienceSubCategory.label: Sub-category
scienceSubCategory.help: SUB-CATEGORY: Select a sub-category that best describes your proposal.

1.value: This field takes the right ascension of a target in Sexagesimal format '+/-HH:MM:SS.S'.

2.value: This field takes the declination of a target in Sexagesimal format '+/-DD:MM:SS.S'.

sensCalc.0: All sensitivity calculations for this observation are valid
sensCalc.1: One or more sensitivity calculations for this observation are invalid
sensCalc.3: Sensitivity calculations for this observation are in progress

spectralAveraging.help: The factor by which the intrinsic spectral resolution should be averaged. The Effective resolution field displays the channel width after applying the spectral averaging.
spectralAveraging.label: Spectral Averaging

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

subBands.help: Number of sub-bands to split the bandwidth up into, which can be set to 1 - 32 for MID and 1-4 for LOW. The default number of sub-bands is 1.
subBands.label: Number of sub bands

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range
range.bandwidthSubBand: Sub-band bandwidth is too low - reduce number of sub-bands

subArrayConfiguration.label: Subarray Configuration
subArrayConfiguration.help: Select a subarray configuration from the list.

submitBtn.label: Submit
submitBtn.tooltip: Progress the proposals to the submitted state

velocityType.help: Select either Velocity or Redshift as required

suppliedType.help: The sensitivity for the observation in units of Jy/beam or K is used to calculate the integration time needed to reach this sensitivity. If the integration time of the observation is given, this is used to calculate the sensitivity that will be reached with this integration time.

suppliedUnits.help: Select the unit that is appropriate

suppliedValue.help: Add the required time, selecting the appropriate unit, to reach the desired target sensitivity or the required sensitivity which will be used to estimate the required integration time

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

tapering.help: Select value from the list. A circular Gaussian taper may be applied to the uv data. It specifies the FWHM of an image-domain Gaussian, in arcsec; tapering the uv data is equivalent to convolving with this image-domain Gaussian.
tapering.label: Tapering

targetImport.help: Upload a list of targets in .csv format in the reference system selected. Currently only Equatorial is available so define targets in ra: 'hh:mm:ss.s' and dec: 'dd:mm:ss.s' format.

targetMosaic.label: Target Mosaic
targetMosaic.toolTip: Current functionality is not yet available

targets.label: Targets

title.helper: Please enter your title information. This field supports latex syntax. - Word count {{current}} / {{max}}

uploadCsvBtn.label: Upload CSV File
uploadCsvBtn.uploadSuccessMsg: All targets in file have been uploaded into the proposal
uploadCsvBtn.uploadErrorPartialMsg: Partially uploaded - some rows contain empty values which will be omitted

validationBtn.label: Validate
validationBtn.tooltip: Performs enhanced validation upon the proposal
validationBtn.tooltipDisabled: Disabled until all pages have a status of OK

velocity.label: Velocity
velocity.help0: This can be specified as either a velocity in km/s or m/s, or as a redshift using the field dropdown.  This field will be populated by the Resolve functionality if the value is in SIMBAD or NED.
velocity.help1: This can be specified as either a velocity in km/s or m/s, or as a redshift using the field dropdown.  This field will be populated by the Resolve functionality if the value is in SIMBAD or NED.

weather.help: The default value for the weather PWV (Precipitable Water Vapour) is 10 mm, corresponding to “average” conditions. Allowed values range between 3 and 25 mm. The PWV is used in the calculation of the atmospheric brightness temperature.
weather.label: Weather

range.error: Value is outside of allowed range

weighting.label: Weighting
weighting.help: The calculator offers natural, uniform or Briggs weighting. For Briggs weighting, the robustness parameter can be set to -2 (closest to uniform weighting), -1, 0, 1 or 2 (closest to natural weighting).
